member.name: N:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement
member.summary: This namespace contains APIs in the Microsoft Store Services SDK that you can use in conjunction with features in the Windows Dev Center dashboard to engage with your customers. These features include running app experiments with A/B testing, launching Feedback Hub from your app so that users can submit feedback that you can respond to in the dashboard, logging custom events from your app that you can review in the dashboard, and sending targeted push notifications from the dashboard to your app.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesCustomEventLogger
member.summary: Provides members you can use to log events from your app to Windows Dev Center.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesCustomEventLogger.GetDefault
member.summary: Gets a StoreServicesCustomEventLogger object that you can use to send log data to Windows Dev Center for the current user of the app.
member.returns: An object that you can use to send log data to Windows Dev Center for the current user of the app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesCustomEventLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a custom event from your app to Windows Dev Center.
member.param: The name of the custom event to send to Dev Center.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesCustomEventLogger.LogForVariation(Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation,System.String)
member.summary: Logs a view or conversion event for an A/B test from your app to Windows Dev Center.
member.param: An object that provides context about the experiment variation that your app is processing. Pass the StoreServicesExperimentVariation object that you retrieved via the GetCachedVariationAsync or GetRefreshedVariationAsync method.

The name of the view or conversion event to send to Dev Center. This value must match the name of a view or conversion event that you associated with the current experiment in the Experiments page of the Dev Center dashboard.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode
member.summary: Defines error codes for a StoreServicesExperimentVariationResult or StoreServicesNotificationChannelRegistrationResult object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.None
member.summary: The action succeeded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.NetworkConnectionFailure
member.summary: A connection to the network could not be established.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.ServerSideError
member.summary: A Windows Dev Center server error has occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.InvalidServerResponse
member.summary: The server response contained invalid data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.Other
member.summary: The error cannot be classified as one of the known errors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.Unknown
member.summary: An exception occurred but the state or cause cannot be determined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.Canceled
member.summary: The action was canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.FileOperationFailure
member.summary: An error occurred while performing a file operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementErrorCode.ValidationFailure
member.summary: An error occurred during validation of the server payload.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementManager
member.summary: Provides members you can use to configure your app to receive targeted push notifications from Windows Dev Center.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementManager.GetDefault
member.summary: Gets a StoreServicesEngagementManager object that you can use to configure your app to receive targeted push notifications from Windows Dev Center.
member.returns: An object that you can use to configure your app so it can receive Windows Dev Center notifications for the current user of the app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementManager.ParseArgumentsAndTrackAppLaunch(System.String)
member.summary: Notifies Windows Dev Center that your app was launched in response to a targeted push notification from Dev Center, and returns the original launch arguments for your app.
member.returns: The original launch arguments that were passed to your app, stripped of the opaque tracking ID that helps Dev Center track the launch of the app.
member.param: The launch arguments that were passed to your app, including an opaque tracking ID that is used by Dev Center to track the launch of your app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementManager.RegisterNotificationChannelAsync
member.summary: Registers your app to receive Windows Dev Center notifications.
member.returns: A StoreServicesNotificationChannelRegistrationResult that represents the result of the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementManager.RegisterNotificationChannelAsync(Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelParameters)
member.summary: Registers your app to receive Windows Dev Center notifications, with the option to specify the notification channel to use for the notifications.
member.returns: A StoreServicesNotificationChannelRegistrationResult that represents the result of the asynchronous operation.
member.param: An object that specifies the notification channel to use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesEngagementManager.UnregisterNotificationChannelAsync
member.summary: Explicitly invalidates the channel that is being used for notifications so the app no longer receives push notifications from any services, including targeted Windows Dev Center push notifications and other notifications using Windows Push Notifications Services (WNS).
member.returns: True if the unregister operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation
member.summary: Represents a variation for an A/B experiment that you have configured in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.ExperimentId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the experiment that is associated with this variation.
member.returns: The ID of the experiment that is associated with this variation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.ExperimentName
member.summary: Gets the name of the experiment that is associated with this variation.
member.returns: The name of the experiment that is associated with this variation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.ExperimentProjectId
member.summary: Gets the unique project ID of the experiment that is associated with this variation.
member.returns: The unique project ID of the experiment that is associated with this variation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.IsStale
member.summary: Indicates whether the current variation assignment needs to be refreshed from the server.
member.returns: true if the current variation assignment needs to be refreshed from the server; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.VariationId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the experiment variation that has been served to the app.
member.returns: The ID of the experiment that is associated with this variation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.GetBoolean(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a variation value for the specified Boolean setting for an A/B experiment that you have configured in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
member.returns: A variation value for the setting specified by the name parameter.
member.param: The name of the Boolean setting value that you want to retrieve.

The default value for the setting. The GetBoolean method returns this default value if it is not able to retrieve the specified value from Dev Center (for example, if there is no network connectivity), and a cached version of the variation is not available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.GetCachedVariationAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the current locally cached variation assignment for the specified experiment.
member.returns: A StoreServicesExperimentVariationResult that represents the result of the asynchronous operation. This object provides access to the locally cached variation assignment.
member.param: The project ID of the experiment for which you want to retrieve the locally cached variation assignment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.GetDouble(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a variation value for the specified Double setting for an A/B experiment that you have configured in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
member.returns: A variation value for the setting specified by the name parameter.
member.param: The name of the Double setting value that you want to retrieve.

The default value for the setting. The GetDouble method returns this default value if it is not able to retrieve the specified value from Dev Center (for example, if there is no network connectivity), and a cached version of the variation is not available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.GetInt32(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a variation value for the specified Int32 setting for an A/B experiment that you have configured in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
member.returns: A variation value for the setting specified by the name parameter.
member.param: The name of the Int32 setting value that you want to retrieve.

The default value for the setting. The GetInt32 method returns this default value if it is not able to retrieve the specified value from Dev Center (for example, if there is no network connectivity), and a cached version of the variation is not available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.GetRefreshedVariationAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the latest variation assignment for the experiment from the server.
member.returns: A StoreServicesExperimentVariationResult that represents the result of the asynchronous operation. This object provides access to the latest variation assignment.
member.param: The project ID of the experiment for which you want to retrieve the latest variation assignment from the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariation.GetString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a variation value for the specified String setting for an A/B experiment that you have configured in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
member.returns: A variation value for the setting specified by the name parameter.
member.param: The name of the String setting value that you want to retrieve.

The default value for the setting. The GetString method returns this default value if it is not able to retrieve the specified value from Dev Center (for example, if there is no network connectivity), and a cached version of the variation is not available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariationResult
member.summary: Provides access to a variation assignment for an A/B experiment that you have configured in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariationResult.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the code for an error that occurred.
member.returns: The code for an error that occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariationResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets additional detail about an error that occurred.
member.returns: A string that contains additional detail about an error that occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesExperimentVariationResult.ExperimentVariation
member.summary: Returns a StoreServicesExperimentVariation that represents the current variation assignment.
member.returns: A StoreServicesExperimentVariation that represents the current variation assignment.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesFeedbackLauncher
member.summary: Provides members you can use to launch Feedback Hub and take users to your app's area so they can submit and upvote feedback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesFeedbackLauncher.GetDefault
member.summary: Gets a StoreServicesFeedbackLauncher object that you can use to launch Feedback Hub and take users to your app's area so they can submit and upvote feedback.
member.returns: An object that you can use to launch Feedback Hub and take users to your app's area so they can submit and upvote feedback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesFeedbackLauncher.IsSupported
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Feedback Hub is installed on the device.
member.returns: Returns true if the Feedback Hub is installed on the device; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesFeedbackLauncher.LaunchAsync
member.summary: Launches Feedback Hub and takes users to your app's area so they can submit and upvote feedback.
member.returns: Returns true if the Feedback Hub is installed on the device and the method successfully opened the Feedback Hub; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesFeedbackLauncher.LaunchAsync(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IMap`2)
member.summary: Launches Feedback Hub and takes users to your app's area so they can submit and upvote feedback. This overload passes a dictionary of metadata that you want to associate with the user feedback.
member.returns: Returns true if the Feedback Hub is installed on the device and the method successfully opened the Feedback Hub; otherwise, false.
member.param: A dictionary of key and value pairs that contain metadata that you want to associate with the user feedback, such as the name of the page the user is on or the game level they completed. The following keys are reserved for use by Microsoft: feedbackid, src, form, screenshot, metadata, uri, foldername, searchstring, newfeedback, yes, and feedbackfiles.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelParameters
member.summary: Contains data to pass to the RegisterNotificationChannelAsync method overload when you register your app to receive Windows Dev Center notifications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelParameters.CustomNotificationChannelUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI of the notification channel to use for receiving Windows Dev Center notifications.
member.returns: The URI of the notification channel to use for receiving Windows Dev Center notifications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelParameters.CustomSystemId
member.summary: This property is reserved for future use, and is not intended to be used in your code.
member.returns: This property is reserved for future use, and is not intended to be used in your code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelParameters.CustomUserId
member.summary: This property is reserved for future use, and is not intended to be used in your code.
member.returns: This property is reserved for future use, and is not intended to be used in your code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the StoreServicesNotificationChannelParameters class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelRegistrationResult
member.summary: Provides access to the notification channel URI and error data returned by the RegisterNotificationChannelAsync method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelRegistrationResult.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the code for the error that occurred.
member.returns: The code for the error that occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelRegistrationResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets additional details about the error that occurred.
member.returns: Additional details about the error that occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Services.Store.Engagement.StoreServicesNotificationChannelRegistrationResult.NotificationChannelUri
member.summary: Gets the URI of the notification channel that was used to register your app to receive Windows Dev Center notifications by using the RegisterNotificationChannelAsync method.
member.returns: The URI of the notification channel that was used to register your app to receive Windows Dev Center notifications by using the RegisterNotificationChannelAsync method.
